meanings.definition: A white pigment, usually made of lead carbonate, used in cosmetics and painting.
meanings.sent1: The artist used ceruses to create highlights in the painting.
meanings.sent2: She bought ceruses to mix with other colors for her art project.
meanings.sent3: The makeup artist accidentally spilled ceruses all over the table, creating a snowy mess.
meanings.sent4: The ceruses on the canvas glowed like tiny stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The purity of the ceruses made the artwork stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: To cover or whiten with ceruse.
meanings.sent1: He ceruses his face before going on stage to make his skin look flawless.
meanings.sent2: The old house was cerused to give it a fresh, clean appearance.
meanings.sent3: She ceruses her teeth with a special paste to make them shine like pearls.
meanings.sent4: The snow ceruses the landscape, turning everything into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The chef ceruses the cake with a layer of icing, making it look like a work of art.
